Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, is it true? Is there really an investigator coming aboard?
Where did you hear that?
It's all over the ship. It's all anyone can talk about. Despite me trying to change the subject to the Emperor, I might add.
Speaking of which, have you heard any news about him?
Oh, well, actually, now that you mention it... wait a minute, you're not going to distract me that easily! Is there an investigator on their way or not?
It seems that way. I only heard recently myself.
This is fantastic news!

Fields.MenuText: I have to disagree. I'm not a fan of the idea.
I agree. It's about time we get some answers.
Fantastic news? I'll wait until I meet this investigator before I make that declaration.

Fields.DialogueText: Why not? Don't you want answers? I don't like not knowing what's going on aboard my ship.
Exactly. This mystery needs to be solved, Kanchou.
No matter who the investigator is, it's still fantastic news for us.
This means that Command is as concerned with solving this mystery as we are. This is good news.
*ALARM*
It seems good news is consistently followed by bad news.
Well then, let's blow up this bad news in service of the Emperor!
@BATTLE
Do we know when we're to expect this investigator, Kanchou?
Could be any day now. I was only told to expect them soon.
The sooner the better.
The sooner the better for what?
Officer Kohei! I was just talking to the kanchou about the...
Myōkō.
What is it, Kanchou?
I don't think our kanchou wants you sharing too much information with me about the investigator.
Kanchou, you aren't still holding onto these suspicions, are you? We're all the crew of Myōkō. We all serve Command. Officer Kohei and I both serve the Emperor.
We can't let this investigation tear us apart.

Fields.MenuText: You might be right, Myōkō.
I'm not sure who I can trust, Myōkō.
Do you really trust him, Myōkō?

Fields.DialogueText: When it comes to matters that concern Japan, I'm usually right.
You can trust me, right? Just focus on that fact and listen to me.
I trust everyone on board. It's the only way we can defeat the Morgana threat.
Well said, Myōkō. Don't worry, Kanchou. I'm no killer. And I'm glad to hear there's an investigator on their way to prove as much.
I just hope that what has happened to past newcomers doesn't happen to this investigator as well.
What do you mean?
Think about it.
*ALARM*
Well, this has been a pleasant conversation. But duty calls.
Hai, duty calls. See you both on deck.
Do you really trust everyone on board, Myōkō? I thought...
When you don't trust someone, Kanchou, it's important to make them feel as if you do.
You're clever, you know that?
I do!
@BATTLE
Honestly, Kanchou, I still don't know who to trust on board the ship.
I understand. If Officer Shino didn't really write that note... anyone could have.
Exactly. I can count the people I still trust on the ship with two fingers.
I hope I'm one of those fingers.
Of course, Kanchou. There's you and...
Myōkō, I hope you're having a pleasant day.
Takura! I was just thinking about you!
Oh, thank you for the hug, but be careful. You don't want to smash the poppo-yaki.
More poppo-yaki? You're too good to me, Takura.
It's the least I can do, really. I hope I wasn't interrupting anything, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: No, we were just making idle chatter.
We were in the middle of an important, private conversation.
I was just asking Myōkō who she trusted most on board.

Fields.DialogueText: It's okay, Kanchou. You can tell Takura. Besides you, she's the person I trust most on the ship.
A conversation that Takura is more than welcome to join. I trust her, Kanchou.
And I was about to say you, Takura.
You're far too kind, Myōkō. I don't feel like I've earned that kind of trust yet.
Oh, don't be silly. If I didn't have my hands full of poppo-yaki, I'd give you another hug to make you believe it.
*ALARM*
You might want to eat those quickly.
Ohhh, but I like to savor them.
I can hold them for you if you'd like, Myōkō.
Have you ever known me to let go of poppo-yaki without a fight?
@BATTLE
Myōkō, I'd like it if you could stay close to me for the time being.
Close to you, Kanchou? Why?

Fields.MenuText: I can't just enjoy your company?
It's dangerous on the ship right now. And growing more dangerous as time goes on...
Well, if you'd rather not spend time around me...

Fields.DialogueText: You can... but I have a feeling there's more at play here.
More dangerous? I hope you're not expecting more death, Kanchou.
Īe! That's not it at all! I just feel like there's something you're not telling me.
The investigator should be here soon. I'm just worried that things will escalate once they board.
You're worried about me? Kanchou, as long as I'm still afloat, I'm fine. You're flesh and blood. You need to look after yourself.
I figure that if we remain close, I can look after you and you can look after me.
Well, I like the sound of that. We'll keep each other out of danger.
That's what I wanted to hear.
*ALARM*
Speaking of having one another's backs...
Let's consider this a warm-up!
@BATTLE
You're the investigator?
I prefer the title Inspector. Inspector Ward. You can call me Ward, if you'd like.
You're British.
Aren't you quite the detective? What gave it away, the accent?
There's no need to be rude.
I apologize - I was just having a spot of fun. I meant no harm. It's been a long trip.

Fields.MenuText: Why did Command send you?
Not used to the high seas, are you?
Give your words a little more thought before you say them, please.

Fields.DialogueText: Because I'm the best at what I do. As you'll soon see for yourself.
The heat affects me more than the seas. I'm accustomed to drear and damp. I'm afraid I didn't dress for this weather.
Of course, sir. I'm here to do my job, nothing more.
Why would Command send a Brit to investigate our... troubles? I'm a Japanese ship - the Japanese government should have petitioned for a Japanese investigator.
From what I've gathered, the Japanese government hasn't shown much interest in the crimes perpetrated on board this vessel.
Well, that can't be true. What would you even know of it?
I just know what I'm told. And what I inspect. So, if you'd escort me to...
*ALARM*
I hate when that happens.
Excuse us. We've...
I know the drill.
@BATTLE
Hmmm... so this is where you say he went over?
Yes, he was very descriptive in his suicide note.
About the railing he was going to jump over? Peculiar.
Well, the note said he wanted to end his life... where he first saw me...
Oh? A lover's quarrel, perhaps?
It was nothing like that! And what are you writing?!
I like to keep notes. It helps my process. So, this Shiro was infatuated with you?
Shino. And he seemed to certainly... appreciate her.
Hmmm... it's not unheard of with Belles. Many men have developed feelings for them. Some women as well.
Really? It's a common occurrence?
As common as any other romance aboard a naval vessel.

Fields.MenuText: I understand. Belles can be quite... enchanting.
I don't see the appeal. Never been attracted to ships, personally.
They're not so different from any other woman.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmmm? Perhaps this Shiko wasn't the only admirer.
Same here, Captain. I prefer my women flesh and blood.
In many ways. Though if you do them wrong, they could blow you to pieces with all their artillery.
All the same, I'd say if Shiko took his own life, you're somewhat responsible, Myōkō.
His name is Shino.
I'm no good with names. But all the same, you don't feel a little responsible?
Īe. All the... feelings he mentioned in his note... he never spoke of them with me. I had no idea.
Hmmm... Interesting.
*ALARM*
You know what that means.
I do. I'll make myself scarce. Knock ‘em dead.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, do you think the inspector is right?
Right about what? About you being to blame for Shino's death?
Hai. When I first learned about his... feelings for me, I didn't think... Do you think there was something I could've done to keep all this from happening?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe. But there are probably things many of us could have done too.
There's a lot about Shino's death that we don't know, Myōkō. Let's focus on better understanding what happened.
He was obsessed with you. No matter how you acted... who knows how that would have affected him?

Fields.DialogueText: I just wish I knew. And I wish this had never happened.
That would probably be a better use of my time.
I suppose there really is no way of knowing.
Myōkō, you didn't push Shino overboard or tell him to jump. You had no part in his death.
You're not wrong... but what if I...
No. I want you to stop dwelling. That's an order.
All right. You're right. There's nothing I can do about the past, but I can do my best to make the most of my time in the present.
I'm going to go find Inspector Ward and see if he needs any help.
*ALARM*
Morganas. Let's deal with them first. Once we're finished with them, we can track down Ward together.
Another excellent idea, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
He should be somewhere around here. The officers said they saw him near the railings where Shino jumped over.
Perhaps he found a clue that lead him somewhere else?

Fields.MenuText: Let's hope so. Clues are what we need right now.
If that's the case, who knows where he could have ended up?
Well, maybe we should start looking around for that same clue.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. How else are we to solve this mystery?
We'll find him. He sticks out on this ship.
Oooh, I like that idea! We could be like detectives ourselves!
Kanchou, Myōkō. What's going on here?
Oh, hello, Kohei. We were just looking for the Inspector.
Oh, right, the foreigner. I saw him here not but a moment ago. I've been keeping a close eye on him. I'm not sure I trust him.
That's hurtful. As far as I'm concerned, I'm the only trustworthy person on this ship!
Where did that voice come from!?
It sounded like it was coming from... over the railing?
Ughh, my upper arm strength isn't what it used to be...
Inspector Ward?! What are you doing hanging from the railing like that?
Eavesdropping. Uhff. And inspecting. I was looking for clues from Officer Tino's perspective.
It was Officer Shino.
Mmhmm... sure. Anyway. I think I'm done here. I'm going to need to see the rest of the ship. I have a few places in mind. I hope playing tour guide won't be much of a problem for you.
I'm far too busy. You'll have to find your own way around, inspector.
Actually, I was talking to the Belle.
Oh, it would be my pleasure. I know this ship like... well, like I know myself.
Makes sense.
Just don't get in anyone's way. We're in the middle of a war here, after all.
You don't have to remind me. I work for the INPF, same as you. We're all here because of the war.
*ALARM*
And so are they.
Gomen nasai, Inspector Ward, but duty calls.
I'll be in the mess. The food on your ship is better than the average warship.
@BATTLE
That's a big meal there, Inspector.
This? It's mostly an appetizer. You ready to lead me around the ship, tour guide?
Ready when you are. And you can call me Myōkō.
I'll do my best to remember, but you're going to have to be patient with me. I can barely remember Shiny's name, and he was the victim.
Shino.
See? Anyway, take a seat. We can leave when I finish eating. The ship isn't going anywhere.
Myōkō. It's nice to see you. Is that... who is this?
Oh, Takura, have you not met Inspector Ward yet? He was sent to investigate the events surrounding Shino's death.
Oh, uh, no, I haven't had the pleasure. It's a pleasure to make your acquaintance, Mr. Ward.
Miss... Takura... you're the nurse on board, right?
Medical Officer.
Forgive my mistake. According to the captain's reports, Officer Shiny was last seen headed to the sick bay before his disappearance. Is this correct?
Does... does he mean Officer Shino?
Hai... he does that. He's not very good with names.
I... I wouldn't know. I never saw him. The last person to see him before he died was Officer Kohei.
Before he disappeared.
Excuse me?
Without the body, and with all the skepticism surrounding the legitimacy of his suicide note, I'm not yet convinced that the officer is dead. So for now, it's a disappearance.
Oh... uh, okay?

Fields.MenuText: Do you think he ran off on his own?
Do you think he was murdered?
What, do you think he was snatched away or something?

Fields.DialogueText: It's possible... you've reported several officers abandoning their posts, haven't you?
Possibly. I haven't ruled out anything. All of my questions have been answered with more questions since I stepped foot on this ship.
In a world of mystical ship spirits... sure, maybe he was abducted or kidnapped in the middle of the night. Why not?
As of right now, I don't know what happened. All I know is that, before I leave this ship, all my questions will be answered.
I admire your zeal, Mr. Ward. I have no doubt you'll find your man.
At this point, we don't even know it's a man. A woman could be responsible. Or a tiger, for all I know.
Anyway, enough shop talk. I like to enjoy my meals in peace.
*ALARM*
We don't get a lot of that on this ship.
If we can assist in your investigation in anyway, Inspector Ward, please let us know.
Of course. Now, get going. Let me eat.
He's an... interesting man.
That's one way to put it.
@BATTLE
Myōkō, there you are. I've been looking all over the ship for you.
Oh, I'm sorry, Kanchou. Inspector Ward asked me to show him to Officer Shino's room. Well, actually, he said Officer Kino, but I knew what he meant.
I told you I wanted you to stay by my side. I thought something had happened to you.
You were busy with paperwork. I didn't feel the need to bother you.
Feeling a little overprotective, Kanchou? No need to worry, she's perfectly safe. She's been an excellent Watson to my Holmes.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not being overprotective. I'm being careful.
Well, I'm just glad to see she's in one piece.
Who to your what? You're talking nonsense.

Fields.DialogueText: There can be a fine line between those two things.
Of course she is. She was with me. No one has ever come to harm under my watch.
Sorry, I suppose I should keep my audience in mind.
Have you found anything worthwhile in your search?
Well, I've been looking through the officer's belongings, and it's beginning to look more and more like foul play to me.
Really? Why is that?
Well, first of all, the only thing pointing to suicide is the note. No one saw him go over, which in itself is odd.
And this notebook isn't filled with the thoughts of someone contemplating suicide. This bloke was clearly serious about his love for Japan.
He was! Very impressive detective work, Inspector Ward.
I'm not even getting started. But I don't want to get ahead of myself. Just know that I believe the man didn't go over that railing of his own accord.
*ALARM*
Well, on that somber note... those Morganas aren't going to defeat themselves.
Hurry back, Miss, and we can do some more inspecting.
It would be my pleasure. But first, duty calls.
@BATTLE
Myōkō, are you okay? You had a few close calls there.
I'm perfectly fine, Kanchou. I've been through much worse for the Empire.
Myōkō, you must be careful following a battle. We can't have you overexerting yourself.
I'll be fine, Takura. You don't have to worry about me. I'm shipshape, as always.

Fields.MenuText: Takura is right, Myōkō. You shouldn't push yourself unnecessarily.
I think she'll be fine, Takura. She's been through worse.
I'm not sure who to side with here. Myōkō, are you sure you're okay?

Fields.DialogueText: Now you're worrying about me, too, Kanchou? I'm sturdier than you might think.
Exactly. I take Funayūrei fire every day. This was nothing special.
It might be the adrenaline talking, but I feel perfectly fine!
I really must insist, Myōkō. Please!
I don't have the time, Takura. Inspector Ward is waiting for my assistance. We have a mystery to solve.
Let her have her way, Takura. She'll run out of energy eventually. Then you can look her over while she's passed out.
Sounds like a compromise to me. Now, let's get going, Kanchou. We've kept the Inspector waiting long enough.
Just please be careful!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
So, Kohei, I hear you were the last person to see Officer Chito alive. Is that correct?
Didn't I already answer all your questions? Kanchou, how long do I have to put up with this? I have work to do.

Fields.MenuText: He does have work to do. He's taken over Shino's position, after all.
Just give him what he wants, Kohei. The faster you answer, the faster you can get back to work.
Don't look at me. He's leading the investigation. I'm just a bystander here.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. All the more reason I need to question him.
Listen to your captain. Answer my questions. Please.
Or a kind of chaperone.
Anyway, where were we? Oh, yes, that's right. You were about to confess.
Confess what? I didn't do anything.
I didn't say you did. Confess could mean many things.
Back to the matter at hand. Tell me about the last time you saw Officer Shino.
Hey, you got it right that time!
Did I? That's a first.
... I was escorting Officer Shino to sick bay after he suffered an injury in battle. However, along the way, we got in an argument, and I left him to find his own way there.
Hmmmm... so one could say that you left him... for dead?
I certainly would not say that. It's not as if I left him bleeding out on the floor.
And yet he ended up ''committing suicide'' not long after.
It would seem that way, wouldn't it?
We can't blame Kohei for what happened to Officer Shino. They were always getting on each other's nerves.
Arigatō, but I don't think you're helping my case, Myōkō.
I mean that it would have been more suspicious if you had helped him without storming off. Your short temper is completely in character.
... If that's all, I'll be heading back to work. Before my short temper gets the better of me.
I didn't say he could leave, but it's all right.
I think I might've said something wrong.
Actually, you made some good points. We still have some investigating to do.
*ALARM*
That'll have to wait.
Maybe the Morganas could sense us getting close to cracking this case.
Mmhmm... that must've been it. Now go and burn off some of that energy.
You don't have to tell me twice!
@BATTLE
Have you enjoyed your time with the inspector, Myōkō?
You know, I wasn't his biggest fan at first, but I'm starting to warm up to him. He's really letting me help with his investigation. I feel like a detective myself!

Fields.MenuText: I think you're more like his assistant, Myōkō.
I'm sure you've been nothing but helpful.
Just make sure you don't get in his way.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm an assistant detective. It's the same thing. Either way, I'm helping solve this mystery for Japan.
Well, you know me. I'm always helpful.
I'm not getting in his way! He told me I was helping.
You know, whenever I see you two together, he just seems awfully... unhappy.
That's just who he is. I don't think I've ever seen him smile.
You know... I don't think I have either. Let's hope he's not depressed.
Are you... worried that he's going to jump overboard next?
Takura!?
I think that's going too far...
*ALARM*
Let's keep those kinds of thoughts out of mind. We have a fight to win.
@BATTLE
Watch your step, Officer! You almost took my head off!
You shouldn't have been on deck during the battle! You're not trained for this!
Yes, of course, I'm not trained for getting my head shot off. I apologize for ducking. I should've let you shoot me in the back.
It would have been your own fault! You were out of line!
Can we all please stop fighting?! Can we keep in mind that we're on the same side here?
The same side? He's here because he thinks one of us is a murderer!
I don't think. I know.

Fields.MenuText: Ward, you need to step back. And stay back during battles from now on.
Kohei, I need you to calm down. We can't have you riling up the crew like this.
Myōkō, can you use some Belle magic to settle everything down around here?

Fields.DialogueText: The kanchou is right. You should stay in your room while we're fighting.
Please listen to him, Kohei. I can sense what the crew is feeling right now. It's not good.
That's not how it works, Kanchou. If it were an option, I would have done so already.
Okay, you know what? I'll back down for now. But mark my words, Kozai. This isn't over.
It's Kohei!
I know what it is!
Kohei, are you all right?
You don't think I'm a murderer, do you, Myōkō?
Of course we don't, Kohei.
Thank you for having my back, Kanchou. I'm sorry for making a scene like that. I'll do what I can to calm everyone's nerves.
We can't have the crew thinking that their Belle is losing trust in them.
I'm sorry, Kanchou. I wish I could be more sure of myself... and of my crew.
It's okay. We all understand this isn't a normal situation.
It's just... this isn't like me at all. I'm just... I think I'm scared, Kanchou.
I know, Myōkō.
Kanchou? I'm sorry to intrude, but you're needed on the bridge.
Oh, hell. On my way!
@BATTLE
Why are we meeting in a storage closet, Inspector?
This is no mere storage closet, Kanchou. I actually believe that this...
Was the site of the murder.
This closet? What makes you think that, Inspector Ward?
A detective's eye, Miss. This shelf here is broken. And look at the bottles and supplies on the floor, knocked over and pushed about.
You run an organized ship, Captain. Every other storage closet I've checked is in order.
I believe that the supplies were knocked over in the struggle. Not only that, but here, I found a shard of wood, stained with blood. I believe it's a piece of the murder weapon.

Fields.MenuText: How can you know that's blood?
A little blood on that piece of wood hardly means someone was murdered here.
Inspector Ward, you've cracked the case!

Fields.DialogueText: I've worked as an inspector for many years, Captain. I've seen my share of blood.
True, but if you examine the floor, you find further evidence of blood. Someone tried to clean it up, but they couldn't erase all traces.
Not even close, Captain. We still don't know who actually committed the crime.
So what next?
Well, now that we've found where he was murdered, we need to find out where everyone was during the time of his death. Hopefully someone saw something.
Or someone.
Exactly.
We're getting so close! We're going to find this killer and bring them to justice!
Someone's got a fire in them!
What can I say? I'm tired of being scared.
@BATTLE
Myōkō, what's this I've been hearing about you interviewing the crew?
It was Inspector Ward's idea. He said it would be the quickest way to get answers.

Fields.MenuText: According to a few sailors, you were pretty tough on them.
What happened to staying by my side? I could've interviewed them with you.
Have you been enjoying yourself?

Fields.DialogueText: The inspector thought it'd be a good way to channel my anger. And I have to say, I agree.
The inspector said something about that being a conflict of interest. And I just followed his lead.
Strangely enough... a little, hai.
While I don't think these interviews will do wonders for the crew's morale, I understand their necessity. Have you learned anything?
I think so. Inspector Ward said that he's narrowed his list of suspects to just a handful of people.
I suppose I can't argue with progress. Just remember... we can't let this investigation jeopardize the well-being of the crew at large.
I would never! I have a responsibility to look after my crew.
Well, I mean... with one major exception. I can't make any promises about that one.
That doesn't sound very Buddhist of you.
Oh! I... I didn't think about it that way. I may need to work on my anger a little.
@BATTLE
Captain, I'm going to need your authorization to sweep a couple of rooms.
A couple? There are easily a dozen rooms on this list. Myōkō said you only had a handful of suspects.
What can I say? I have big hands.
At least it's not the entire ship, Kanchou. With my assistance, we should be able to search those rooms in no time at all.
What she said.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not so sure about this.
As long as you catch the killer, do what you have to do.
I'm surprised you're asking for my permission.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, you can trust me.
Arigatō, Kanchou. I'm glad we're on the same page!
Are you still upset about the interviews? We were just asking questions.
No innocent person should mind our searching their quarters.
You're starting to sound a little too much like the inspector, if you ask me.
There's nothing wrong with that. I'm a good teacher.
Go search your rooms. Just try to do it discreetly and respectfully.
I'll do my best to keep him in line, Kanchou. Don't worry.
Thank you, Myōkō.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, we need to talk.
It's urgent.
Kohei, Takura, it's surprising to see both of you so worked up. What's going on?
It's the inspector. He's trying to search our quarters. He's claiming that you've given him permission.
And he's trying to force his way into my office in the sick bay. I have confidential patient files in there.
I'd rather not give that bastard the chance to plant something incriminating on our property.
Listen...  I did give Ward permission to search your rooms.
What?!

Fields.MenuText: If you have nothing to hide, it shouldn't be an issue.
Would it make you feel better if I went in with him?
No one suspects you, Kohei. If you expect trust, you must give some in turn.

Fields.DialogueText: It has nothing to do with trying to hide something. I just don't trust him.
That's... that's far from the point. Don't I deserve a modicum of privacy?
I... I... I don't know what to say. I'm not happy about this.
As for the medical files, I didn't think about that, Takura. But I assure you that's not what Ward's interested in.
Whether he's interested or not, they're still there.
You can be there with him while he's searching the room. And I'll accompany you, just to make sure nothing goes wrong. Okay?
I suppose that will be fine. I can make sure he doesn't start snooping anywhere unnecessary.
The same goes for you, Kohei. You're free to be there while he searches, but he's going to search.
This isn't right, Kanchou. You shouldn't be allowing him to...
*ALARM*
Morganas. This discussion is over. I suggest you make your peace with it, Kohei.
Urrrgh. Hai, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Thank you for allowing me in this time, Ms. Takito.
It's Takura. And I'm only allowing this because the kanchou is here too.
I'm just glad we came to a resolution without starting another war.
I'm not seeing anything suspicious here, Inspector Ward.
Oh, what's this?
Excuse me! That's my journal! It's private.
Privacy has no place in a murder investigation.

Fields.MenuText: Ward, give her back the book. It's not like it's the murder weapon.
Inspector Ward is right. We need to know everything. We don't know what could crack this case.
Myōkō, what's your opinion here?

Fields.DialogueText: The kanchou is right. I wouldn't feel right reading Takura's journal without her permission.
Are you sure, Kanchou? You're really okay with this?
I think Takura deserves her privacy in this matter. She's always writing in that book, after all.
Oh, look at that. I can see why you didn't want me to read this.
Stop reading that!
Give that to me!
Take it. As interesting as your secret... feelings are, they don't seem to be of any interest to my case.
I don't see anything that could be the murder weapon, inspector.
And I'm not seeing any traces of blood.
Well, of course not. I don't see patients here.
It's time to move on. I apologize for intruding.
*ALARM*
Actually it sounds like it's time to battle. You with me, Myōkō?
I'm with you, Kanchou.
@BATTLE
Myōkō, what happened to Officer Kohei?
He was injured in our last engagement. I don't know what he was thinking. He made such a beginner mistake.
I guess... I got sloppy.
This... this is going to get worse before it gets better, Officer Kohei. Come with me.
I'm in your hands.
I hope he's going to be all right.
I heard about Kohei. Apparently he jumped in front of a Morgana blast.

Fields.MenuText: That's not quite what happened.
Practically. I don't know what he was thinking.
Have a little tact. A man is injured.

Fields.DialogueText: I think it is.
I think he was scared, but not of the Morganas.
The time for tact is over. I think this proves that we're close to finding the truth.
What are you saying, Inspector Ward?
Kohei wanted you to keep me from inspecting his room, but he was promised that he could be there when the inspection happened, correct?
That's right. So?
So, now, just before we were scheduled to search his room, Kohei's gone and gotten himself seriously injured. Now we have to wait.
I see what you're saying... That is a little suspicious.
I'm of the mind that we shouldn't wait for him to recover. What do you think, Cap?
I need to think about this.
Think fast. He won't be stuck in bed forever.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Have you come to a decision yet, Kanchou? Are we going to search Officer Kohei's room or wait for him to recover?

Fields.MenuText: Searching his room right now just seems callous.
We need answers... don't we?
I'm not sure. Being the captain isn't always easy.

Fields.DialogueText: It might, but what if Inspector Ward's right?
We do. And they might be waiting for us in Officer Kohei's room.
Well, if you want me to make the call, I can go in without you.
So, I take it you want to search while Kohei's still in the infirmary?
I think it's the smart move. The Inspector's pretty convinced Kohei's guilty. We need to find out one way or another.
And what if he's wrong? Kohei won't be happy.
Is he ever happy?
You have a point.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Kohei certainly has an appreciation for traditional Japanese weaponry.
You've never talked to him about his sword collection? He's really proud of it.
I'm thinking he might be overcompensating.
What do you mean? What does he mean, Kanchou?
It's not important. We should focus on looking for clues.
He's right. Bring me anything noteworthy.

Fields.MenuText: What about this big sword? Could it be the murder weapon?
Oh, I found his underwear drawer. Now this feels like a breach of privacy.
What exactly do you mean by noteworthy?

Fields.DialogueText: We're looking for something made of wood. By the amount of blood, I'm guessing it was just a good whack to the head that did him in. So nothing sharp.
Not what we're here for. The only thing we can prove with his undies is bad taste.
Something that proves he's a murderer. What else are we here for?
Japan really makes the best blades. These are all of such high quality.
I see why he would like showing them off.
Well, except for this one. Why's this one not hung up?
Oh, that's just a bokuto. It's a wooden katana for training. I imagine he doesn't bother hanging it up if he trains with it often.
A wooden sword, you say? Let me see that.
It... it has a red stain on one side. Does that mean this is our murder weapon?!
That, or he cut himself shaving. Repeatedly. Over the course of several months. With a wooden sword.
Do you have that wooden shard?
It's right here. And look, here's a crack where it fits perfectly. I think we have our killer.
*ALARM*
We have our answers, but we still have to defend ourselves.
And afterwards, we have a murderer to confront.
@BATTLE
How could you, Kohei?
I'm sorry. I know I shouldn't have let the Morganas get the better of me like that.
That's not what we're talking about, Kohei. We know what you did to Officer Shino.
We found this in your room. You tried to clean it off, but there are traces of blood all over it. And this shard we found at the murder site fits perfectly.
What are you... that's... that's not mine!
Kohei, it has your name engraved on the hilt.
I've seen you practicing with it before.

Fields.MenuText: Accept it. We've got you.
How could you do this, Kohei?
I want to believe you, but the evidence is overwhelming.

Fields.DialogueText: I guess you do...
I... I didn't mean to... I...
I thought I... I should've thrown it overboard.
Why did you kill Officer Shino?!
I think I can answer that.
You both were in love with the young Belle here. You thought she liked him more than you, so in a fit of jealous rage, you took out the competition.
Kohei?!
What? Īe, that's not it at all! I just... I wanted his position. I was the best man for the job. I had scared away all his predecessors, but Shino was hardier than the rest.
Even injuring him wasn't enough to get him to run for the hills. He was ready to walk it off. So... I tried to hurt him a little more, but I went too far.
Okay... so I was way off. Still got the right man, though.
So you're the reason we've had so many people leaving their posts. You were chasing them off, trying to climb the ranks.
I'm the best man for this job. Japan needs me in this position. I just needed to get here to prove it.
Well, all you've proven now is that you're a murderer. Come on, you're coming with me to the brig.
Kohei...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I still can't believe it. Kohei has been sabotaging this ship for so long...
I think he was a bit of a fanatic. He thought what he was doing was the best thing for Japan. He was wrong, but he didn't see it that way.
I love the Empire, but I'm not sure I could ever kill a comrade for it. I'd serve up my own life, but to take a friend's... could you ever do something like that, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: Depends on the friend.
No, I don't think so.
If the Empire asked it of me, then unquestioningly.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't make jokes now, Kanchou. I don't think you could ever hurt a friend.
That's because you're a good person.
The Empire would never ask that. Not the Empire I love.
I thought I'd feel better after we found the killer, but... I just feel worse.
Myōkō, I just heard about Officer Kohei. He didn't try to hurt you when you confronted him, did he?
Īe. Don't worry, Takura. He just... he kind of accepted it.
Thank heavens. I wouldn't be able to forgive myself if I patched him up only to have him hurt you.
If the two of them got in a fight, I'm pretty sure Myōkō would be the one to come out on top.
*ALARM*
Great... I'm not sure I'm in the mood to fight, but... for Japan. Let's do this, Kanchou!
Myōkō...
@BATTLE
So that's that. I'll make sure the prisoner gets where he's going. It was a pleasure working with you. Hope I don't ever see you again.
What kind of goodbye is that?
Well, in my line of work, if I see you again, it's because someone's dead.
In that case, I hope our paths don't cross for a good long time.
Or maybe we can just meet next time for a happy occasion. Like a birthday, or a holiday!
Doubtful. Take care, Kyoko.
Myōkō. My name is Myōkō.
That's what I said!
Some people never change.
That man... I didn't like him at first, but I think he grew on me.

Fields.MenuText: I still don't like him.
Like a fungus. In a good way, I mean.
What are you talking about? We were all best friends from the second he stepped on board.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? He's not all that bad. He just takes a little getting used to.
Heh. If we ever have need of an investigator again, we know who to call.
You're kidding, right? I remember thinking he was just a big buffoon who couldn't even remember my name.
Kanchou, I want to thank you for helping me through this.
Thank me? You were the one working with Ward to find the murderer.
Hai, but I could only do that because you made me feel safe again. When you asked me to stay by your side throughout this, I didn't feel like I was surrounded by strangers anymore.
I'm happy I could make you feel safe, Myōkō. And if you ever feel unsafe again, there's always a spot open at my side.
I'll keep that in mind. Arigatō, Kanchou.
